page.title: 06DARTMOUTH'S BUILDINGS
page.content: {Historic buildings}play an important part in Dartmouth in 1985, as an attraction to tourists as well as serving the commercial life of the town. Two churches date back from the 12th century.{St. Clement's}was mother church to{St. Saviour's}but the latter has assumed greater importance because it is more central. {Agincourt House,}now an antique shop, was once a 14th century merchant's house. One of Dartmouth's public houses, {"The Cherub",}was originally a 14th century dwelling whose timbers have been exposed fairly recently. When they enter Batterbees, a local hardware and electrical shop, customers can see the original staircase and fine plasterwork of the 18th century{"Mansion House".
